snippet: The group took six villages near Aleppo and threatened to cut off an important route north to the Turkish border.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran. Reporting was contributed by Dan Bilefsky and Helene Cooper from London, and Hwaida Saad and Maher Samaan from Beirut.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and THOMAS ERDBRINK

abstract: Islamic State makes significant gains in northwestern Syria, in area that had been target of bombings by Russian warplanes; rival insurgents say ISIS took advantage of fact that Russia is targeting other rebel groups aligned against Pres Bashar al-Assad.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The group took six villages near Aleppo and threatened to cut off an important route north to the Turkish border.

headline.print_headline: Islamic State Fighters Make Significant Gains in Syrian Areas Bombed by Russia
headline.main: ISIS Makes Gains in Syria Territory Bombed by Russia
